entry.title: Data visualisation in PowerPoint with Python
entry.summary:
Description

What if Python created your slides for you?

What if it could create animations in PowerPoint that are not humanly possible to match in terms of fineness, accuracy or richness?

That's what this session aims to do. And to answer the inevitable question "But why PowerPoint?" all I have …
entry.content:
Description

What if Python created your slides for you?

What if it could create animations in PowerPoint that are not humanly possible to match in terms of fineness, accuracy or richness?

That's what this session aims to do. And to answer the inevitable question "But why PowerPoint?" all I have to say is: once you remove PowerPoint's user interface, the underlying canvas and rendering engine is as flexible as SVG or Inkscape.

Plus, corporates love paying for stuff like this.

Description

Talk: Exploring Network Clusters in Python - Anand S

This talk was presented at PyCon India 2021 Online.

PyCon India is the largest gathering of Pythonistas in India for the Python programming language. The 13th edition of PyCon India took place online from 17th Sept to 20th Sept 2021.

Talk Detail: https://in.pycon.org/cfp/2021/proposals/exploring-network-clusters-in-python~e312O/

entry.title: Faster data processing in Python
entry.content:
Description

This talk will covers ways that help process and analyse visualise data faster in Python. The primary focus is on the technique (should you optimise? what to optimise? how to optimise?) while covering libraries that help with this (line_profiler, Pandas, Numba, etc.)
